brainly_data.question:
Some plants on the coast of the ocean have the unique ability to take in salt water. Marsh plants are able to take in the salt water and separate the salt so that they can use the water for photosynthesis. They then excrete the salt onto the surface of their leaves. This trait allows them to survive in a place where many other plants cannot- this is an example of:
speciation


mutation


variation


adaptation
brainly_data.subject: Biology
